alert.note: Alert for Clark; Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 7:10PM PDT until September 01 at 10:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Lincoln County in south central Nevada... North Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 1015 PM PDT. * At 710 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Moapa Town, Coyote Springs, Sr 168 Mile Marker 21, Hayford Pk and Gass Pk. This includes the following roads... Interstate 15 in Nevada between mile markers 61 and 78. Highway 93 in Lincoln County between mile marker 1 and 16. Highway 93 in Clark County between mile marker 53 and 86. State Route 168 in Clark County between mile marker 1 and 21. This includes the following streams and drainages... Wildcat Wash, Farrier Wash, Pahranagat Wash, Battleship Wash, Meadow Valley Wash, Weiser Wash, Whitmore Wash, Muddy River, California Wash and Kane Springs Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
